page.title: Atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki

rev.comment: /* The hibakusha */ Updated information on recent death of Tsutomu Yamaguchi, the last living confirmed "Twice Bombed" survivor
/* Double survivor */ added documentary about 164 other survivors who are not yet recognised by the Japanese government
/* Double survivor */ added date of death from his article - may he rest in peace
/* Post-attack casualties */ number of immediate casualties needs citation
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 335236926 by [[Special:Contributions/Ourshelp|Ourshelp]] ([[User talk:Ourshelp|talk]]) rv crackpot theory per [[WP:FRINGE]]
/* Nagasaki during World War II */ remove unnecessary italics
Why do we want to have the exact same material presented in the lead section and in the article's body?
Expanding the lead to mention the debate over the ethics of the bombing; the section on the debate now needs to be expanded as it replicates the text in the lead
/* Events of August 7-9 */ silly people, thinking they can use the Internet like that. moved {{listen}} above bq, -table
/* The bombing */ better at right at beginning of paragraph
/* Survival of some structures */ better at right
nav boxes are better placed at the end of articles
rewrite first part of lede in active voice, rather than the awkward passive style
[[wp:datescript]]-assisted date/terms audit; see [[wp:unlinkdates]], [[wp:overlink]] No we should not link overly to common terms
seems like we ought to link to US
“Hiroito” was the common name of the Emperor at the time and until nowadays in the Western World
/* The surrender of Japan and subsequent occupation */
/* Japanese realization of the bombing */ broadcast received, not captured
/* Events of August 7-9 */ minor for clarity
Restored facts of the plant's history as the manufacturer of the particular torpedoes used at Pearl Harbor.
/* The surrender of Japan and subsequent occupation */ Punctuation
/* External links */ minor clean up, rmv duplicate
Citation maintenance. [U]Added: doi. Formatted: pages, edition. You can [[WP:DOI|use this bot]] yourself! Please [[User:DOI_bot/bugs|report any bugs]].
clarified a fact and added a citation
Made the sentence a bit easier to understand
/* The bombing */ I don't need you to tell me what's ironic. Give me the (pertinent) facts, and I'll be the one to decide if I think it's ironic or not.
Historical irony is not subjective. There are many such instances in history.
/* The bombing */ this diagram isn't really necessary and is distorting some of the text
moved one image in place of another to make space
/* Nagasaki during World War II */ replaced image of the church with image of the plane and its crew
/* Hiroshima during World War II */ replaced image of the bomb with image of the plane and its crew
/* Survival of some structures */ only italicize the Japanese part of the term
MOST of the people killed in these attacks were civilians, not merely "the majority"
Adding a few internal links from an [[User:Nickj/Can_We_Link_It|online link suggesting tool]].
/* The Manhattan Project */ not assistance, collaberation
/* External links */refine cat and or AWB general fixes using [[Project:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
Several changes to grammar and wording. I'm not tagging this minor because I made quite a few changes.
malnutrition was one of the major causes of death
/* Events of August 7-9 */[[WP:CHECKWIKI]] bracket fixes using [[Project:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
/* Nagasaki during World War II */ Link fmt
/* The bombing */ fix number fmt edit
/* Debate over bombings */clean up, typos fixed: casulaties → casualties (2) using [[Project:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
/* Events of August 7-9 */ Fixed Truman quote
move announcement to correct part of timeline. format images

/* Survival of some structures */ links & distance conversions
No longer need for pipe link
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/Bobert300|Bobert300]] ([[User talk:Bobert300|talk]]) to last version by Twinsday
/* External links */ add external link, fix section titles
Date maintenance tags and general fixes
/* Debate over bombings */ prose, add tag (please cite!)
correction for "thousands of victims died since then" - confusion
/* See also */ arrange order. One more
/* See also */ copyedit. Arrange order alphabetically
/* The bombing */ Fixing unclosed cite tag.
Converting bare references using [[WP:REFLINKS|Reflinks]] | [[wp:datescript]]-assisted date/terms audit; see [[wp:unlinkdates]], [[wp:overlink]]
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/The Anomebot2|The Anomebot2]] ([[User talk:The Anomebot2|talk]]) to last version by Binksternet
clarified that while the US dropped leaflets warning of other air raids, there was no warning about the atomic bomb on Hiroshima
/* Events of August 7-9 */ rm irrelevant material. There is no warning of atomic bomb.
/* The bombing */ damage and casualty numbers
/* The surrender of Japan and subsequent occupation */
/* The surrender of Japan and subsequent occupation */ wikilink "rebellion" -> [[Kyūjō Incident]]
/* Plans for more atomic attacks on Japan */ Another redundant link
/* Plans for more atomic attacks on Japan */ Deleted redundant link
/* Debate over bombings */ Providing an intro to this section
Updating {{[[Template:Cite web|cite web]]}} templates: replaced 'accessdaymonth/monthday/year' parameters with 'accessdate' and 'dateformat'
/* Events of August 7-9 */ Removed the red link
Restoring 7/10ths cloud cover as the more widely understandable 70%
/* Atomic Bomb Casualty Commission */ added rerf
Repairing & tagging external links w/ [[WP:CHECKLINKS|Checklinks]]; formatting: 26x whitespace, 3x heading-style, 2x HTML entity, heading, nbsp-dash (using [[User:Cameltrader#Advisor.js|Advisor.js]])

Reverted to revision 259742554 by [[Special:Contributions/Kusunose|Kusunose]]; Kusunose is right. using [[WP:TWINKLE|TW]]

/* Debate over bombings */ Operation Downfall citation.
/* See also */ 'Japan and weapons of mass destruction'

it is directly related to the justification given in this section for Truman's decision - don't revert again without taking it to the talkpage

trim further to get rid of clauses referring to deleted sentences.

Self revert because I'm not sure if this is more than one revert a week per my previous edits. So better to be on the safe side. See talk, and someone else please restore. Thanks.
see talk. Source is valid and supports the point on the lack of ethical consideration for use against civilians. Also consensus was to keep this.
rv: ethics are important, but not this quote. see talk
restore balance per NPOV. ethics are pretty important and this is an important POV
/* Choice of targets */ removed Non-mainstream opinion that doesn't belong. Added detail.
